intro: Cacalia alpina var. australis, commonly known as the alpine bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the southern regions of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine habitats, thriving in cool, moist environments with well-drained soil. Its leaves are lanceolate and hairy, while its stems are erect and often branched. This variety is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens with suitable climatic conditions.
